thread.title: French presidential candidate Francois Fillon WILL be investigated over payments to family
thread.title_full: French presidential candidate Francois Fillon WILL be investigated over payments to family

title: French presidential candidate Francois Fillon WILL be investigated over payments to family
text:
(COMBO) This combination of pictures cre It was an error; I profoundly regret it and I apologise to the French Francois Fillon 
He said he had hired his family members because he trusted them - although admitted that he recognised such practices “create distrust nowadays”. 
And he added: “It was an error; I profoundly regret it and I apologise to the French.” 
But the announcement that French prosecutors had now appointed a magistrate to investigate allegations could put a further dent in his election chances. REUTERS Francois Fillon was due to take to the stage in a rally when the news broke 
And experts claim that by involving a magistrate in what had so far been a preliminary probe led by police, the prosecutor is putting more resources into the investigation. 
A magistrate would have more powers to investigate the claims, including tapping phones or placing suspects under house arrest. 
But the judge can still decide to drop the case, place the suspect under formal investigation, or send it to trial. GETTY Fillon paid his wife more than €800,000 from public funds 
It is not clear if the inquiry can be concluded before France’s presidential election, scheduled for April 23 and May 7. 
Under French law, the investigation would be suspended for the five-year presidential term, should Fillon be elected. 
Most polls now show Macron, who got a boost this week following the endorsement of centrist Francois Bayrou, is likely to beat Fillon in the first round of the election . REUTERS Francois Fillon is expected to lose to Macron 
He is also expected to win a face off against National Front leader Marine Le Pen in the runoff between the top two candidates two weeks later. 
The polls show either Macron or Fillon would beat Le Pen in the second round, although their expected margin of victory has been shrinking. 
The prosecutor’s statement was issued as Fillon himself was set to take the stage at a campaign rally near Paris. Things you didn't know about Marine Le Pen Mon, February 20, 2017 Marine Le Pen is a French politician who is the president of the National Front, a national-conservative political party in France and one of its main political forces. AFP/Getty Images 1 of 10 Described as more democratic and republican than her nationalist father, she has led a movement of "de-demonization of the Front National" to detoxify it and soften its image 
But his legal team claimed it was confident that the probe would result in Fillon and his wife being found innocent. 
They also reiterated their earlier criticism of the legal process, saying leaks to French media about details of the case were unacceptable. Related articles
